We're going to look at NY NOAA data.

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(p8105.datasets)

library(plotly)

options(
  ggplot2.continuous.colour = "viridis",
  ggplot2.continuous.fill = "viridis"
)

scale_colour_discrete = scale_colour_viridis_d
scale_fill_discrete = scale_fill_viridis_d
```

## Scatterplot

```{r}
data("ny_noaa")

 ny_noaa %>%
  mutate(
    prcp = round(prcp/254, digits = 2)
  ) %>%
  filter(
    date > "2010-10-01",
    prcp > 0
  ) %>%
  drop_na() %>%
  plot_ly(
    x = ~id,
    y = ~prcp,
    color = ~id,
    colors = "viridis",
    type = "scatter",
    mode = "markers")
```

## Boxplot

```{r}
ny_noaa %>%
  mutate(
    snow = round(snow/25.4, digits = 3)
  ) %>%
  filter(
    snow > 1,
    date > "2009-09-01", 
    date < "2010-09-01"
  ) %>%
  drop_na() %>%
  mutate(
    id = fct_reorder(id, snow)
  ) %>%
  plot_ly(
    y = ~snow,
    x = ~id,
    color = ~id,
    type = "box",
    colors = "viridis"
  )
```

## Bar plot

```{r} 
ny_noaa %>%
  count(id) %>%
  mutate(
  id =fct_reorder(id, n)
  ) %>%
  plot_ly(x = ~id, y = ~n, type = "bar", color = ~id, colors = "viridis")
```
